courses.summaryText: A budget simply tracks your income and your expenses each month and informs a plan for how to spend your money. Think about how money and purchases make you feel—it’s actually more than feelings, it’s science. Budgeting is simply dividing up your income into buckets and then accounting for what’s in the bucket.

mcQuestions.questionContent: What is the first step to budgeting?
answerChoices: Finding out how much you bring in on a monthly basis
Figuring out what expenses are essential
Figuring out what to spend your extra cash on
Thinking about how much you should be saving
Spend 50% towards needs, 30% on wants, 20% on saving
Spend 50% on wants, 30% on saving, 20% on needs
Spend 50% the first month, 30% the second, and 20% the third

mcQuestions.questionContent: What are examples of essential needs?

answerChoices: It provides an avenue for immediate gratification
It allows for room to spend on debt

mcQuestions.questionContent: Should you maintain the same budget?
answerChoices: No, your budget should evolve to meet your situation

emailQuestions.questionContent: Explain the concept of delayed gratification and how it relates to budgeting.

courses.summaryText: What are the differences between retirment accounts? Should you invest pre-tax (traditional 401-k) or post-tax (Roth)? Find out the answer to both of these questions in this course! Saving for retirment from a young age is practically the easiest way to become a millionaire by the time you retire! All you need is time and the basic knowledge found in these videos.

mcQuestions.questionContent: What is a benefit of a Roth IRA?
answerChoices: No taxes on money put in
If deductible, contributions reduce taxable income

mcQuestions.questionContent: What is different about a 401k vs a normal IRA?
answerChoices: You can put unlimited money into them annually
They are invested in a separate market

mcQuestions.questionContent: If you take money out of a 401(k) or traditional IRA account before the age of 59½ you can be penalized for early withdrawal.
When choosing investments in your retirement account such as stocks, bonds and mutual funds, what should you consider?
While 401(k)s are opened through an employer, IRAs are opened through which of the following:

emailQuestions.questionContent: Compare and contrast a Roth IRA and a Traditional IRA.
